meanings.definition: The state or quality of being dry.
meanings.sent1: After the rain stopped, the dryness of the desert was evident.
meanings.sent2: The dryness of the towel made it perfect for soaking up spills.
meanings.sent3: The dryness of the cake made it hard to swallow without water.
meanings.sent4: Her humor was as dry as the desert, lacking any hint of moisture.
meanings.sent5: The dryness of the air in the room made her skin feel tight and itchy.

meanings.sent1: The dryness soil cracked under the scorching sun.
meanings.sent2: Her lips were chapped due to the dryness of the winter air.
meanings.sent3: The dryness of the sponge made it useless for cleaning up the spill.
meanings.sent4: The dryness of the toast made it hard to swallow without a drink.
meanings.sent5: The dryness of the desert plants showed their struggle to survive in the arid climate.

meanings.definition: A lack of interest or emotion.
meanings.sent1: The dryness in his voice indicated his disinterest in the topic.
meanings.sent2: Her eyes showed dryness as she listened to the boring lecture.
meanings.sent3: The dryness in the room was palpable as no one seemed engaged in the conversation.
meanings.sent4: The dryness of his response made it clear he was not emotionally invested.
meanings.sent5: The dryness in her smile revealed her lack of enthusiasm for the event.
